title: Trebz28
author: Trebz28
content: GM, fam!It's been a while since my last post and I think this is my last resort.I've been looking for a testnet bitcoin to test some dapps, a Bitcoin Layer 2 to be specific and tried a lot of faucets online that promises for some testnet bitcoin but haven't received any from those. By any chance, do you guys know a legit faucet or if ever you have some, my grandma will gonna appreciate if you can send to my bitcoin testnet address?Here's my addy: tb1q5508uj6h55fzwej2syv9mdruzq38sw86avqq53Thank you so much guys!

comments.author: promise444c5
comments.body: There's a thread by mocacinno on the forum where you can  make request  because  the faucets are barely working as of recent Here's the link try making a requesthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5223320.0

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: Quote from: promise444c5 on May 08, 2024, 09:40:44 AMThere's a thread by mocacinno on the forum where you can  make request  because  the faucets are barely working as of recent Here's the link try making a requesthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5223320.0There are other Bitcoin test net faucets.https://bitcoinfaucet.uo1.net/https://kuttler.eu/en/bitcoin/btc/faucet/https://coinfaucet.eu/en/btc-testnet/https://tbtc.bitaps.com/

comments.author: promise444c5
comments.body: Quote from: Catenaccio on May 08, 2024, 10:03:09 AMThere are other Bitcoin test net faucets.https://bitcoinfaucet.uo1.net/https://kuttler.eu/en/bitcoin/btc/faucet/https://coinfaucet.eu/en/btc-testnet/https://tbtc.bitaps.com/I've  actually used https://tbtc.bitaps.com/ it did work once then but it did not work after that once  although I don't know if it's  now  working And I did used https://bitcoinfaucet.uo1.net/ => it didn't work It only these that I haven't  tested:https://kuttler.eu/en/bitcoin/btc/faucet/https://coinfaucet.eu/en/btc-testnet/

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Trebz28 on May 08, 2024, 09:37:16 AMHere's my addy: tb1q5508uj6h55fzwej2syv9mdruzq38sw86avqq53You already have 1.6 tBTC. Isn't that enough?

comments.author: MarkK11
comments.created_time: May 17, 2024, 08:43:31 AMLast edit: May 20, 2024, 05:11:07 AM by MarkK11
comments.body: Quote from: Trebz28 on May 08, 2024, 09:37:16 AMIt's been a while since my last post and I think this is my last resort.I've been looking for a testnet bitcoin to test some dapps, a Bitcoin Layer 2 to be specific and tried a lot of faucets online that promises for some testnet bitcoin but haven't received any from those. By any chance, do you guys know a legit faucet or if ever you have some, my grandma will gonna appreciate if you can send to my bitcoin testnet address?Thank you so much guys! Publix passport benefitsFor testnet Bitcoin, you can try the faucet at testnet.help, which is a public test network where you can request up to 0.0001 BTC every 24 hours. Just solve the reCaptcha and agree to the terms to receive your testnet Bitcoin.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: BlackHatCoiner on May 08, 2024, 11:35:02 AMQuote from: Trebz28 on May 08, 2024, 09:37:16 AMHere's my addy: tb1q5508uj6h55fzwej2syv9mdruzq38sw86avqq53You already have 1.6 tBTC. Isn't that enough?And looking on https://mempool.space/testnet/address/tb1q5508uj6h55fzwej2syv9mdruzq38sw86avqq53, he own 2 tBTC on that address before creating this thread. So if 1.6 tBTC is really not enough, OP should consider using regtest instead where he can generate as much block as he wants.
